name: BreastCancerStages0ToIIIc
title: Breast Cancer Stages 0 to IIIc
purpose: (Clinical Focus: Identifies patients with a breast cancer diagnosis and staging of cancer from 0 to IIIc),(Data Element Scope: Intended to identify the diagnosis of breast cancer),(Inclusion Criteria: Patients with a diagnosed carcinoma of the breast, and breast area with staging criteria 0 to III c),(Exclusion Criteria: Breast cancer stage IV)

concept.display: Overlapping malignant neoplasm of male breast (disorder)
Malignant neoplasm of nipple and areola of male breast (disorder)
Malignant neoplasm of ectopic site of male breast (disorder)
T1mic: Microinvasion <= 0.1 cm in greatest dimension: BREAST: Complete excision less than total mastectomy, total mastectomy, modified radical mastectomy, radical mastectomy (finding)
T1b: Breast tumor >0.5 cm but <= 1 cm in greatest dimension (finding)
T3: Breast tumor >5 cm in greatest dimension (finding)
Malignant neoplasm of male breast (disorder)
pT1mic: Microinvasion 0.1 cm or less in greatest dimension (breast) (finding)
pT1a: Tumor more than 0.1 cm but not more than 0.5 cm in greatest dimension (breast) (finding)
pT2: Tumor more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in greatest dimension (breast) (finding)
pT1c: Tumor more than 1 cm but not more than 2 cm in greatest dimension (breast) (finding)
pT3: Tumor more than 5 cm in greatest dimension (breast) (finding)
pT1b: Tumor more than 0.5 cm but not more than 1 cm in greatest dimension (breast) (finding)
Family history of malignant neoplasm of male breast (situation)
Neoplasm of breast primary tumor staging category T0: No evidence of primary tumor (finding)
Neoplasm of breast primary tumor staging category T1mi: Tumor <=1 mm in greatest dimension (finding)
Neoplasm of breast primary tumor staging category T1c: Tumor >10 mm but <=20 mm in greatest dimension (finding)
